title: OSAL Wrapper for QNX on R-Car V4H/V4M/S4

description: This document describes updates and restrictions for this release.
This document describes the contents regarding to the OSAL Wrapper for QNX on R-Car V4H/V4M/S4.

table.name: R-Car V4H Ver2.x \n R-Car V4M \n R-Car S4(includes S4N)
table.note: Each SoC requires a BSP provided by Black Berry \n The quality grade of R-Car V4H2.0 and V4H2.1 are always Reference.

table.name: OSAL Wrapper for QNX \n (R-Car S4(includes S4N))
OSAL Wrapper for QNX \n (R-Car V4H Ver2.2)
OSAL Wrapper for QNX \n (R-Car V4H Ver2.0,2.1)

note: The Current/Target Quality grades options are below:
- Current: Sample, Reference, Alpha Beta, QM, ASIL

section.name: Version 0.1.0
description: - This software is verified against normal use-case.
- Refer to Table 2-1 for details on each API status.

section.name: Version 0.2.0
description: - This software is verified against normal use-case.
- Refer to Table 2-1 for details on each API status.

section.name: Version 0.3.0
description: - This software is verified against normal use-case.
- Refer to Table 2-1 for details on each API status.
- Enabled to config the available memory size in r_osal_usr_cfg_info.h

section.name: Version 0.4.0
description: - This software is verified against normal use-case.
- Refer to Table 2-1 for details on each API status.

section.name: Version 0.5.0
description: - This software is verified against normal use-case.
- Refer to Table 2-1 for details on each API status.
- Add R-Car V3H2 to supported device.

section.name: Version 0.6.0
description: - This software is verified against normal use-case.
- Refer to Table 2-1 for details on each API status.
- Add R-Car V3M2 to supported device.

section.name: Version 0.7.0
description: - This software is verified against normal use-case.
- Create the new module “osal_configuration” for resource information.
- Change operating environment from dynamic environment to static environment.
- Refer to Table 2-1 for details on each API status.
- Below Thread manager APIs are implemented. \n
- Below ThreadSync manager APIs are implemented.\n
- Below Message manager APIs are implemented. \n
- Below Interrupt manager APIs are implemented.\n
- Below IO manager APIs are implemented.\n
- Below Memory manager APIs are implemented. \n

section.name: Version 0.9.0
description: - IO read / write is supported for 32/64 bit access.
- Restructure device config and user config[OSAL-1766]

section.name: Version 0.10.0
description: - Move Memory manager configuration to osal_configuration [OSAL-1936]

section.name: Version 1.0.0
description: - Divied the Resource information entity from the osal wrapper binary [OSAL-2238]

section.name: Version 2.1.0
description: - Added to supported device: caiplite_wrapper, icumx

section.name: Version 2.2.0
description: - Added the following restriction, Table 1-3 has more details.
- update stack size of thread for vip

section.name: Version 2.3.0
description: - Resolved following restriction, Table 4-1 has more details.
- Add thread, mutex, cond and mq for pap

section.name: Version 2.4.0
description: - Added the following restriction, Table 1-3 has more details.
- Resolved following restriction, Table 4-1 has more details.
- Fixed following issue, Table 4-1 has more details.
- Update axi bus definition for icumx

section.name: Version 2.5.0
description: - Resolved following restriction, Table 4-1 has more details.
- Fixed following issue, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 2.6.0
description: - Separated OS-dependent processing part and OS-independent processing part \n
Along with the above changes, the structure of the User's Manual has changed.
- The maximum number of resource information has been removed. \n
Note: OSAL user could only define up to 1024, but now OSAL user can have resources up to the memory limit.
- Added following restriction, Table 1-3 has more details.

section.name: Version 2.7.0
description: - Add thread and message queue for CPURTT
- Added following issue, Table 3-1 has more details.
- Resolved following restriction, Table 4-1 has more details.
- Fixed following issue, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 2.8.0
description: - Resource information for R-Car V4H and R-Car S4 are separately defined.
- Change the thread name of interrupt thread defined in the Resource information. No impact on API behavior.
- Resolved following restriction, Table 4-1 has more details.
- Fixed following issue, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 2.9.0
description: - Updated Device information for R-Car V4H
- Updated Device information for R-Car S4
- Changed the behavior when OSAL_MEMORY_MANAGER_CFG_UNLIMITED is specified to p_config->max_allowed_allocations and p_config->max_registered_monitors_cbs of the argument of R_OSAL_MmngrOpen.
- After: When OSAL_MEMORY_MANAGER_CFG_UNLIMITED is specified as an argument, it operates with the maximum value defined in g_osal_memory_max_configration. \n
- Fixed following issue, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 2.10.0
description: - Fixed task name to 15 characters or less
- Fixed following issue, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 2.11.0
description: - Changed configuration of ICCOM interrupt thread definition.
- Updated Device information for R-Car V4H and R-Car S4
- Changed configuration of ICCOM device definition.

section.name: Version 2.12.0
description: - Updated Device information for R-Car V4H
- Set CPU affinity so that target thread run on the specified CPU cores.
- Added CPU affinity value and corespond thread to OSAL Configuration.
- Removed restriction (ASDRCXPOSAL-456) in Table 2-1 API Status List.  \n
This restriction was moved to "1.3. Restrictions" in API User's Manual.
- Fixed following issue, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 2.13.0
description: - Updated Device information for R-Car V4H
- Updated AXI bus name for VDSP
- Fixed following issue, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 2.14.0
description: - Fixed following issue, Table 4-1 has more details.
- The actual release version of OSAL Wrapper is 2.14.0 but R_OSAL_GetVersion returns wrapper version as following. \n

section.name: Version 2.15.0
description: - Added configuration of thread definition for CPURTT.
- Added configuration of mutex definition for CPURTT.

section.name: Version 2.17.0
description: - Fixed following issue, Table 4-1 has more details.

section.name: Version 2.18.0
description: - Updated Device information for R-Car V4M
- Added vdsp00_08,vdsp01_08 for reset control of VDSP

section.name: Version 2.19.0
description: - Added the following error cause explanation in the Wrapper User's Manual.

table.description: [Ver 2.3.0] Updated PM API from dummy implementation to actual implementation.

description: [Ver 2.4.0] Fixed axi id and axi bus name string returned by the following API. \n
[Ver 2.4.0] Fixed following API, PAP device can be set to power on state. \n
[Ver 2.4.0] The following APIs verified against abnormal cases. \n
[Ver 2.5.0] VDSP device can be powered on by using following API. \n
[Ver 2.5.0] Fixed issues that when VSPD0/1 devices is changed released state by using following API, other device is turned off. \n
[Ver 2.5.0] VDSP3_CORE device can be changed released state by using following API. \n
[Ver 2.5.0] No error occurs when controlling the clock of VDSP00_00/01 devices using the following API. \n
[Ver 2.5.0] PAP devices can be powered off by using following API. \n
[Ver 2.5.0] VDSP0n_01 devices can be reset by using following API. \n
[Ver 2.5.0] No clock error occurs when controlling the VDSP devices using the following API. \n
[Ver 2.5.0] CNN devices can be powered off by using following API. \n
[Ver 2.5.0] IPMMU_CACHE_IR device can be powered on/off by using following API. \n
[Ver 2.7.0] Changed the assignment of interrupt thread to be configurable \n
If the following APIs are executed for the irq channel that does not have the interrupt thread assignment, OSAL_RETURN_UNSUPPORTED_OPERATION will be returned. \n
[Ver 2.7.0] Fixed the condition that R_OSAL_ThreadCreate returns OSAL_RETURN_BUSY \n
R_OSAL_ThreadCreate succeeded without R_OSAL_ThreadJoin() if the user function had already finished. \n
Fixed so that R_OSAL_ThreadCreate returns OSAL_RETURN_BUSY when R_OSAL_ThreadJoin is not executed because it differs from other OS behavior. \n
[Ver 2.7.0] Corrected incorrect AXI bus name definition for ivcp1e \n
[Ver 2.8.0] Fixed the problem that VDSP devices can't be control by using OSAL PM API. \n
[Ver 2.8.0] Fixed the problem that reset state can't be control if reset state is changed at out of OSAL. \n
[Ver 2.8.0] Fixed the problem that lowest power state can't be hold correctly. \n
[Ver 2.8.0] Fixed the problem that the unused control table was allocated with size 0 when the interrupt thread config (g_osal_interrupt_thread_config) was only OSAL_INTERRUPT_INVALID_ID. \n
[Ver 2.8.0] Fixed the problem that potential memory leak was occurred during R_OSAL_Initialize. \n
[Ver 2.9.0] Interrupt notifications to processes that do not use interrupts have been eliminated.
[Ver 2.9.0] Fixed the problem that OSAL_RETURN_FAIL is unintentionally returned when calling the following API with the timeout set to 0 in the ISR.
[Ver 2.9.0] Fixed the incorrect minimum and maximum priority values for interrupt threads activated by R_OSAL_InterruptRegisterIsr.
[Ver 2.9.0] Improved the method of synchronization between user thread and internal thread. \n
[Ver 2.9.0] Added HWA definition that missed, to fix control power/clock dependency for imp_slim_dmac and smd_post_00. \n
[Ver 2.10.0] Fixed wrong HWA dependency information, to be able to reset VDSP devices correctly. \n
[Ver 2.12.0] Fixed the behavior of R_OSAL_PmGetLowestIntermediatePowerState not as expected. \n
Befor: The just before Power State was retained as LowestIntermediatePowerState. \n
After: The LowestIntermediatePowerState set by checking the actual HW state after transitioning to Released State.
[Ver 2.12.0] Fixed an issue where CPG dependencies were not implemented correctly.
[Ver 2.12.0] Fixed incorrect return value when a device name with more characters than OSAL_DEVICE_TYPE_NAME_MAX_LENGTH
is specified for the first argument "p_device_type_name" of R_OSAL_IoGetNumOfDevices(). \n
[Ver 2.12.0] Fixed incorrect return value when executing R_OSAL_PmSetResetState for HWA without reset assignment. \n
[Ver 2.12.0] Fixed vdsp00_02 - vdsp00_07 devices to be Reset only devices.
[Ver 2.13.0] Fixed R_OSAL_PmWaitForState cannot wait state transition of the HWA unsupporting reset operation.
Befor: In spite of the Power State of the other HWA sharing same domain is changed , LowestIntermediatePowerState of the HWA is not changed. \n
After: If the Power State of the other HWA sharing same domain is changed, LowestIntermediatePowerState of the HWA is changed correctly.
[Ver 2.14.0] Fixed R_OSAL_InterruptEnableIsr returning unintended OSAL_RETUNR_FAIL due to incorrect exclusive control.

[Ver 2.17.0] Fixed incorrect reflection of power settings to hardware when the following R-Car V4M devices were specified to each OSAL Power APIs due to incorrect definition of power domain settings and dependencies. \n
